You are going to be assigned to some impossible to achieve project, so badly managed from the beginning that is obviously due to fail, but even if you do all your best and manage to complete it, one day you will find yourself suddenly in a room with your line manager and someone from HR that you never spoke with before that will fire you, without even some warning before. The IT is very badly managed with a lot of issue and legacy procedure that stay there even they don't makes any sense. There is also a toxic blaming culture and the HR department is basically useless and never present. They will tell you that this is how companies in finance work, well is not like that. Is full of decent companies out there that are just more human than this.

How I feel:

cons: Run down office (Curzon street). Poor comp. Poor pension. Bad management including what amounts to bullying of certain employees. Cycle to work scheme is an absolute joke. High turnover of employees.

headline: Great company
pros: quality of people, great brand and reputation
cons: too much change in the recent years

headline: Success driven by AHL performance.
pros: People are smart and most are very nice.
cons: P&L still largely driven by success of AHL and hence state of trend following environment.

headline: Once glittered is no longer gold...
pros: Entrepreneurial spirit, diversity of opportunity, willingness to support internal moves, occasionally interesting culture. A lot of fun, bright people. If you're in the right part of the business and friends with the right people can be very lucrative. Lunch budget is provided, although significantly less than it once was.
cons: Highly political environment, senior management operate a very hedge fund approach which doesn't mix so well with a public company, very short term view, long working hours (in certain roles). Extreme discrepancies in terms of pay.

headline: client services specialist
pros: the place had some friendly senior members
cons: very very aggressive nature in the client services team

headline: A great company that kept changing with the times, giving opportunities for development
pros: As the company was always evolving my role was also always changing giving me opportunities for development. There was also a real "can do" attitude which combined with a rather flat management structure meant that any idea for an employee, no matter how junior, could get done.  However the best thing of working there was the staff. Some fantastic colleagues.
cons: Man used to be a very decentralised company, but as part of cutbacks, everything got centred in London. So if you were not based there, there was limited opportunities for development.

headline: Senior BA operation
pros: The atmosphere accross colleague was great
cons: The management seemed to be lacking of decision

headline: Lazy Senior Management with no vision
pros:
Overpay across ranks and functions
Better to be an employee than a shareholder or client
Strong retail distribution platform
Some smart people still around from the old days
cons:
Don't listen to client needs
Expensive products with limited transparent on fees
Senior Management detached from staff and clients
Hire rather than promote internally

headline: Really smart people, tough times recently
pros: Excellent people, good benefits, plush new London HQ
cons:
Top heavy management

Redundancies mean remaining staff are stretched quite thinly

headline: great grounding and place to work but enviorment changed
pros: given responsibility early on and were able to move internally if you made the right contacts
cons: changed to a blame culture as times weren't as good

headline: Too much knowledge has gone out of the door
pros:
The pay is pretty good, as are the benefits and the location
There are opportunities to learn and stretch yourself as it's very hands on
cons: Redundancies and resignations mean that the remaining staff are spread thinly and a lot of knowledge has gone out of the door.  Morale remains low with a lot of uncertainty around job security.

headline: (AHL) Good quant business being strangled by poor management
pros:
Interesting work.
Some excellent people still left
cons:
Poor bonuses have led to a lot of the best quants departing.
Atmosphere is poor and there is high turnover
Too top heavy in terms of management with most people in management roles being relatively weak.
Core technology team are relatively disconnected from the business and develop irrelevant things while breaking important things.

headline: Taken over by new management from GLG
pros:
Good hours
Lunch benefit
Relaxing atmosphere with tea breaks
cons:
Upper management (and new hires of upper management) lack investment skills. Most of them do not have a track record of investing, some have very bad ones. Plenty of "senior" employees made their way up by being there in early days without contributing, when the company made easy money in the financial markets

Some management decisions have cost client/firm badly in terms of financial and reputation, but were not held accountable. As a result, mid level employees were penalised for underperformance

headline: Too big
pros:
Good benefits
Will promote from within the organization
London office gets free lunches and has a good cafeteria
- - - - - -
cons: The company is mired in bureaucracy. Too many top level executives with bloated salaries and too much administration. Lack of focus on real performance. Mergers have weakened the company. Most of the performers have left the company.

headline: Work hard, play hard harder!
pros: Objective related bonus scheme incentive
cons: There were no cons, to speak of.

headline: Senior Fund Accountant
pros: Great benefits,career potential,frendly work  environment
cons: The company closed a lot of business units

headline: Not great
pros: Great brand on the CV
cons: Not growing at the moment

headline: Great place to work when things going well
pros: Good atmosphere, mostly friendly co-operative teams, interesting projects, feeling that the company cares about its staff, e.g. flexible benefits, decent bonuses, free lunches. Starting to accept flexible working/tele-working.
cons: Taken on more staff than it should have over the last few years, so lost some of the enjoyable "hedge fund" feel, and now having to make severe cut-backs.
